intro: Sphenomeris clavata, commonly known as the clustered spiky vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sphenomeris clavata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
